title: Switch nixpkgs URL to optimized channel tarball format
description:
Current nixpkgs input uses github:NixOS/nixpkgs/nixos-unstable (GitHub archive format). Vanixiets uses https://channels.nixos.org/nixpkgs-unstable/nixexprs.tar.xz (channel tarball), which is smaller, faster to fetch, and avoids GitHub rate limiting.

Adopt the tarball URL pattern from vanixiets for the primary nixpkgs input.
close_reason: Implemented in 293d46d

title: Add crane.inputs.nixpkgs.follows and align cache declarations with vanixiets
description:
Two related flake hygiene items:

1. crane input has no follows directive, causing a redundant independent nixpkgs evaluation. Since crane is a build library with no upstream cache, adding inputs.nixpkgs.follows = nixpkgs eliminates the extra eval with no cache downside.

2. Cache declarations are minimal (3 substituters) compared to vanixiets (9). Add cache.nixos.org explicitly, numtide.cachix.org, and cameronraysmith.cachix.org to nixConfig.
close_reason: Implemented in e3a9997, added crane/numtide/cache.nixos.org caches

title: Investigate and validate optimal test strategy for PyO3 + Python hybrid packages
description:
The current devShell excludes pnt-cli from uv2nix editableOverlay because maturin packages are incompatible with pyprojectFixupEditableHook (expects EDITABLE_ROOT which maturin does not set). This means nix develop -c pytest cannot import pnt_cli._native, failing both locally and in CI.

This task requires investigation and experimentation to determine the optimal testing strategy for packages containing both Python and Rust code via PyO3 extension modules, using maturin as the build backend and crane for Rust build artifact caching.

Questions to answer through experimentation:

1. Can we install pnt-cli non-editable in the devShell virtualenv (pre-built wheel via Nix) so pytest can import _native? What are the trade-offs for developer iteration speed?

2. What is the correct split between cargo nextest (pure Rust unit tests in crates/) and pytest (Python integration tests that exercise the PyO3 bindings)? Should these be separate CI jobs or a unified test recipe?

3. Can maturin develop be integrated into the devShell shellHook or a just recipe to build the extension in-place for iterative development? How does this interact with the uv2nix virtualenv?

4. How do the reference implementations handle this?
   - ~/projects/nix-workspace/uv2nix — upstream patterns for maturin/PyO3 packages
   - ~/projects/nix-workspace/pyproject.nix — Python project tooling for Nix
   - ~/projects/nix-workspace/nix-cargo-crane — crane patterns for Rust builds
   - ~/projects/rust-workspace/ironstar — crane devShell integration (Rust-only but relevant caching patterns)

5. For the template test (omnix init + validate): should instantiated templates use nix flake check (builds everything through Nix including maturin wheel), nix develop -c uv run pytest (uv builds the wheel), or a combination?

6. Does the nix build path (nix flake check / nix build) already exercise both Rust compilation (via crane cargoArtifacts) and Python tests (via pytest in check phase)? If so, it may be sufficient for CI validation without needing devShell-based testing.

Acceptance criteria:
- Document the chosen test strategy with rationale
- Validate that both cargo nextest (Rust unit tests) and pytest (Python integration tests) pass
- Validate the strategy works both locally (nix develop) and in CI (template instantiation test)
- Update devshell.nix, justfile, and template.yaml as needed to implement the chosen strategy
- Ensure crane artifact caching is preserved (no unnecessary Rust rebuilds)
close_reason: Resolved via test relocation: pnt-cli tests moved from src/pnt_cli/tests/ to tests/ (outside source namespace). This avoids source tree shadowing the installed wheel with _native.so. Strategy: Rust tests via cargo nextest (devShell + crane checks), Python tests via pytest from package dir (installed wheel). maturin develop not needed. nix flake check validates both build paths.

title: Remove nixpkgs follows from pyproject-nix chain to restore cache hits
description:
The pyproject-nix, uv2nix, and pyproject-build-systems inputs all declare inputs.nixpkgs.follows = nixpkgs, which forces them to use our nixpkgs revision. Since pyproject-nix.cachix.org builds against their own pinned nixpkgs, the follows override causes derivation hash mismatches, forcing source rebuilds of maturin, python-libcst, and other build-system packages.

Remove the nixpkgs follows from all three inputs while keeping the internal cross-references (pyproject-build-systems.inputs.pyproject-nix.follows and .uv2nix.follows) since those are co-released.

Before: source rebuilds of maturin/libcst on every devshell entry.
After: cache hits from pyproject-nix.cachix.org for build-system packages.
Tradeoff: second nixpkgs evaluation during flake eval (acceptable for build tool cache hits).
close_reason: Implemented in e3a9997

title: Migrate to dendritic flake-parts with import-tree
description:
Restructure nix module architecture to match reference implementations (vanixiets, ironstar, typescript-nix-template).

Changes required:
- Add import-tree as flake input (github:vic/import-tree or equivalent)
- Move nix/modules/*.nix to modules/*.nix (top-level)
- Replace readDir-based discovery in flake.nix with: flake-parts.lib.mkFlake { inherit inputs; } (inputs.import-tree ./modules)
- Add systems.nix module (extract system list from flake.nix)
- Add flake-parts.nix module (external module imports like nix-unit)
- Keep nix/packages/pnt-cli/ and nix/lib/ as non-module utilities (imported explicitly by python.nix)
- Update all relative paths in modules that reference nix/packages/ or nix/lib/ (now one level up)
- containers.nix is 355 lines — evaluate splitting into containers/dev.nix and containers/production.nix
- Update template.nix conditional paths to reflect new module locations
- Verify nix flake check passes after restructure
- Update .github/workflows/ path filters if they reference nix/modules/

Key architectural decisions:
- Modules communicate through _module.args (python.nix exports) and config namespace (pre-commit.devShell)
- import-tree auto-discovers all .nix files in modules/ tree
- No manual imports list in flake.nix — adding a file to modules/ auto-includes it
- nix/packages/ stays as explicit utility imports (not auto-discovered modules)

description:
Update the dev container builds (containerImage, devcontainerImage) to use nix2container once nixpod itself has completed its nix2container migration.

Current state:
- nix/modules/containers.nix imports buildMultiUserNixImage from nixpod
- nixpod uses dockerTools.buildLayeredImageWithNixDb internally
- flocken handles multi-arch manifest creation for dev containers
- Dev containers include multi-user Nix daemon, home-manager activation, s6-overlay

Blocked on: nixpod completing its nix2container migration (refactor-container-builds branch has research docs with full API mapping and implementation plan)

Target state:
- nixpod exports nix2container-based builders (buildMultiUserNixImage rewritten internally)
- python-nix-template's dev containers consume upgraded nixpod
- Dev container manifests use crane-based tooling (from pnt-5vr production container work)
- s6-overlay, home-manager activation, multi-user Nix preserved in container content

Acceptance criteria:
- Dev containers build using nixpod's nix2container-based API
- flocken fully removed from flake.nix (production containers handled by pnt-5vr)
- No regression in dev container functionality (Jupyter, code-server, etc.)
- Multi-arch publishing works via nix2container transport

Reference: ~/projects/nix-workspace/nixpod-home/docs/notes/development/container-build-refactoring.md
Reference: ~/projects/nix-workspace/nixpod-home/containers/nix.nix

title: Evaluate pkgs-by-name-for-flake-parts adoption for package auto-discovery
description:
Vanixiets uses pkgs-by-name-for-flake-parts for automatic package discovery from pkgs/by-name/. Python-nix-template currently hard-codes package paths in modules/python.nix, requiring manual updates for each new package.

Direct adoption is feasible but python-nix-template packages need Python-specific overlay composition (crane integration, maturin compatibility, editable overlay exclusion). Requires designing a Python-aware discovery layer or adapting the pkgs-by-name pattern to emit overlays rather than standalone derivations.

This is architectural preparation for multi-package growth. Lower priority than cache and follows fixes.
close_reason: Won't-fix: pkgs-by-name auto-discovery is incompatible with uv2nix overlay composition model. Packages are overlays composed into a shared set, not standalone derivations. Two-file Rust pattern (rust.nix + default.nix) also incompatible with single-file-per-package structure.

title: Cross-compile and release pnt-cli wheels for all major platforms via crane pkgsCross
description:
Build and release platform-specific Python wheels for pnt-cli (PyO3/maturin package with Rust extension modules) across all four major targets: x86_64-linux, aarch64-linux, x86_64-darwin, aarch64-darwin.

Current state: pnt-cli builds and tests on a single platform via hand-rolled crane + maturin + uv2nix overlay composition (nix/packages/pnt-cli/rust.nix and default.nix). It has never been released. semantic-release is configured in packages/pnt-cli/package.json but predicts no pending release.

Research findings: Nix pkgsCross is not viable for PyPI wheel distribution. No project in the ecosystem uses Nix cross-compilation to produce manylinux-compatible wheels. The industry standard is GitHub Actions + maturin-action with manylinux containers for Linux and native runners for macOS. crane-maturin (vlaci/crane-maturin) provides a thin wrapper over crane that eliminates hand-rolled boilerplate for maturin builds.

Scope (three phases):

Phase A — crane-maturin refactor (no new capabilities):
- Add vlaci/crane-maturin as flake input (pinned)
- Replace nix/packages/pnt-cli/rust.nix + default.nix with single buildMaturinPackage call via mkLib
- Update modules/python.nix overlay composition to use crane-maturin's output pattern
- Verify nix flake check and nix develop -c pytest pass for all 3 packages
- Benefit: automatic two-phase cargo caching, PYO3_PYTHON handling, passthru.tests (pytest, clippy, doc, fmt, test, audit)

Phase B — CI wheel build workflow (new capability):
- New workflow: .github/workflows/wheel-build.yaml
- Matrix: linux-x86_64, linux-aarch64, macos-x86_64, macos-aarch64
- Linux: maturin-action with manylinux: auto (pure Rust, no custom containers needed)
- macOS: native runners (macos-15 for arm64)
- Python 3.12 only (template users extend as needed)
- Artifact upload per platform
- Concrete for pnt-cli but with clear parameterization points (package name, maturin args as workflow variables)

Phase C — release pipeline:
- Coordinate with existing package-release.yaml
- Trigger: semantic-release creates tag → dispatches wheel builds → collects artifacts
- Publish to PyPI via uv publish with trusted publishing (OIDC)
- Include sdist alongside wheels
- Existing packages/pnt-cli/package.json semantic-release config drives versioning

Reference implementations:
- ~/projects/nix-workspace/crane-maturin — vlaci/crane-maturin source (mkLib API, buildMaturinPythonPackage.nix)
- ~/projects/nix-workspace/pyperscan-uses-crane-maturin — flake.nix overlay pattern, CI workflow structure
- pydantic-core, polars, cryptography — industry standard maturin-action CI patterns

Out of scope:
- Nix cross-build outputs (nix build .#packages.aarch64-linux.pnt-cli from x86_64-linux) — separate concern
- Multiple Python version matrix — start with 3.12, extend later
- omnix template parameterization — edit-in-place customization

comments.author: Cameron Smith
comments.text:
Checkpoint: Phase A complete, Phase B in progress

Done (Phase A — crane-maturin refactor):
- Moved Cargo workspace root from packages/pnt-cli/crates/ to packages/pnt-cli/ so pyproject.toml and Cargo.toml share the same src root (required by crane-maturin)
- Added vlaci/crane-maturin as pinned flake input
- Replaced rust.nix + default.nix with single crane-maturin integration in default.nix
- Overlay uses hybrid approach: augments uv2nix base via overrideAttrs (preserving pyproject-nix resolver metadata for devShell) while pulling cargoVendorDir and passthru.tests from crane-maturin's standalone buildMaturinPackage
- nix flake check passes with expanded test suite: pnt-cli-{clippy,doc,fmt,pytest,test(nextest)}
- nix develop -c python confirms native module loads correctly
- 3 clean atomic commits: Cargo restructure, flake input, crane-maturin refactor

Key learning:
- crane-maturin's buildMaturinPackage cannot directly replace the uv2nix overlay entry because pyproject-nix's resolveVirtualEnv needs passthru.dependencies metadata that buildPythonPackage does not produce
- The hybrid approach works: crane-maturin for standalone build + test suite, uv2nix overrideAttrs for the overlay entry with crane's cargoVendorDir injected via preBuild
- crane-maturin's `pname` parameter silences crane workspace name warnings

Remaining (Phase B + C):
- Phase B: wheel-build.yaml with maturin-action matrix (linux + macOS, Python 3.12)
- Phase C: release pipeline coordination with package-release.yaml

Branch: pnt-wbq-cross-compile-wheels (3 commits ahead of pnt-5vr-nix2container)

title: Align Cloudflare docs deployment with vanixiets preview-promote pattern
description:
Align python-nix-template docs deployment workflow with the preview-promote pattern from vanixiets and typescript-nix-template. Currently pnt has preview deployment but no production promotion logic, uses a two-job workflow with artifact upload, lacks link validation, and uses yarn-berry where vanixiets/tnt use bun.

Changes required:

1. Migrate from yarn-berry to bun:
   - Remove yarn.lock, .yarnrc.yml, and any yarn configuration
   - Add bun to the devShell (modules/devshell.nix)
   - Replace all yarn dlx wrangler / yarn dlx references with bunx wrangler / bunx
   - Update package.json scripts if they reference yarn
   - Generate bun.lock (or bun.lockb) from package.json
   - Update .gitignore for bun artifacts
   - Update CI workflows that reference yarn
   - This aligns tooling exactly with vanixiets and typescript-nix-template

2. Add docs-deploy-production justfile recipe with version promotion logic:
   - Look up existing wrangler version by 12-char commit SHA tag
   - If found: promote to 100% production traffic (zero rebuild)
   - If not found: fall back to build and deploy directly
   - Reference: vanixiets scripts/docs/deploy-production.sh and tnt justfile docs-deploy-production

3. Align docs-deploy-preview with vanixiets pattern:
   - Branch name sanitization (40-char subdomain-safe)
   - Git metadata capture (12-char SHA tag, commit message, clean/dirty status)
   - Use bunx wrangler (after yarn-to-bun migration)

4. Refactor deploy-docs.yaml workflow:
   - Single-job pattern with environment branching (preview vs production)
   - Use setup-nix composite action instead of DeterminateSystems/nix-installer-action
   - Add link validation step (just docs-linkcheck or equivalent for Quarto)
   - Add cached-ci-job execution caching
   - Preview triggered on PR, production triggered on push to main/beta

5. Evaluate wrangler.jsonc location:
   - Currently at repo root, vanixiets/tnt have it in packages/docs/
   - pnt docs are in docs/ (not packages/docs/), so repo root may be appropriate
   - Ensure assets.directory path is correct relative to wrangler.jsonc location

6. Worker naming convention:
   - Current: python-nix-template (matches repo name)
   - vanixiets pattern: infra-docs, tnt pattern: ts-nix-docs
   - Choose appropriate worker name for the template

Reference implementations:
- ~/projects/nix-workspace/vanixiets justfile (docs-deploy-preview, docs-deploy-production), deploy-docs.yaml, packages/docs/wrangler.jsonc, scripts/docs/deploy-production.sh
- ~/projects/nix-workspace/typescript-nix-template justfile, deploy-docs.yaml, packages/docs/wrangler.jsonc

Note: pnt uses Quarto (not Astro) so build commands differ, but the wrangler deployment pattern and bun tooling are framework-agnostic.
close_reason: Implemented across 18 commits on branch pnt-yty-cloudflare-docs-alignment (dd698bf..e03ca68). Phase 1: yarn-to-bun migration (devshell, package.json, justfile, lockfile, CI hash-sources). Phase 2: preview-promote docs deployment (docs-deploy-preview with branch sanitization and SHA tagging, docs-deploy-production with version promotion, single-job deploy-docs.yaml with environment branching, wrangler.jsonc schema and observability). Alignment: GitHub preview/production environments created, preview-docs job runs on every PR (removed label gate), ::notice annotations for predicted semantic-release versions, preview-version.sh ported from tnt with merge-tree simulation. CI verified green on PR 45 (run 21652296092). Fix for preview-release-version local branch requirement pushed (e03ca68), awaiting CI confirmation.
